<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:82px; top:148px; width:177px; height:22px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:22px">C</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:16px">ONFESSION</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:22px"> </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:16px">OF</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:22px"> F</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:16px">AITH
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:142px; top:229px; width:56px; height:13px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:13px">Chapter 1
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:109px; top:244px; width:123px; height:13px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:13px">Of  the Holy Scripture
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:35px; top:270px; width:270px; height:194px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">1.  Although the light of  nature, and the works of  creation and
<br>providence do so far manifest the goodness, wisdom, and power of
<br>God, as to leave men unexcusable;</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">a</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px"> yet are they not sufficient to give
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">that  knowledge  of   God,  and  of   his  will,  which  is  necessary  unto
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">salvation.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">b</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">  Therefore  it  pleased  the  Lord,  at  sundry  times,  and  in
<br>divers manners, to reveal himself, and to declare that his will unto his
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">a.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Rom. 2:14–15.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> For when the Gentiles, which have not the law, do by nature
<br>the things contained in the law, these, having not the law, are a law unto themselves:
<br>which shew the work of  the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing
<br>witness, and their thoughts the mean while accusing or else excusing one another.
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Rom. 1:19–20.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Because that which may be known of  God is manifest in them; for
<br>God hath shewed it unto them. For the invisible things of  him from the creation of  the
<br>world are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made, even his eternal
<br>power  and  Godhead;  so  that  they  are  without  excuse.    </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Ps.  19:1–4.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">  The  heavens
<br>declare the glory of  God; and the firmament sheweth his handywork. Day unto day
<br>uttereth speech, and night unto night sheweth knowledge. There is no speech nor
<br>language, where their voice is not heard. Their line is gone out through all the earth,
<br>and their words to the end of  the world. In them hath he set a tabernacle for the sun.
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">See Rom. 1:32–2:1.
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:35px; top:464px; width:270px; height:73px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">b.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">John 17:3.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> And this is life eternal, that they might know thee the only true
<br>God, and Jesus Christ, whom thou hast sent.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">1 Cor. 1:21.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> For after that in the wis-
<br>dom of  God the world by wisdom knew not God, it pleased God by the foolishness of
<br>preaching to save them that believe.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">1 Cor. 2:13–14.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> … which things also we speak,
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">not in the words which man’s wisdom teacheth, but which the Holy Ghost teacheth;
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">comparing spiritual things with spiritual. But the natural man receiveth not the things
<br>of  the Spirit of  God: for they are foolishness unto him: neither can he know them,
<br>because they are spiritually discerned.
<br></span></div><span style="position:absolute; border: gray 1px solid; left:0px; top:622px; width:342px; height:522px;"></span>
<div style="position:absolute; top:622px;"><a name="2">Page 2</a></div>
<div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:648px; width:4px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">2
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:116px; top:648px; width:109px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">THE CONFESSION OF FAITH
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:261px; top:648px; width:44px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">CHAPTER 1
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:665px; width:270px; height:69px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">church;</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">c</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px"> and afterwards, for the better preserving and propagating
<br>of  the truth, and for the more sure establishment and comfort of  the
<br>church against the corruption of  the flesh, and the malice of  Satan
<br>and of  the world, to commit the same wholly unto writing:</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">d</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px"> which
<br>maketh the Holy Scripture to be most necessary;</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">e</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px"> those former ways
<br>of  God’s revealing his will unto his people being now ceased.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">f
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:734px; width:270px; height:34px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">2.  Under the name of  Holy Scripture, or the Word of  God writ-
<br>ten, are now contained all the books of  the Old and New Testament,
<br>which are these:
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:778px; width:270px; height:27px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">c.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Heb. 1:1–2.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> God, who at sundry times and in divers manners spake in time
<br>past unto the fathers by the prophets, hath in these last days spoken unto us by his Son,
<br>whom he hath appointed heir of  all things, by whom also he made the worlds.
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:806px; width:270px; height:101px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">d.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Luke 1:3–4.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> It seemed good to me also, having had perfect understanding of
<br>all things from the very first, to write unto thee in order, most excellent Theophilus,
<br>that thou mightest know the certainty of  those things, wherein thou hast been in-
<br>structed.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Rom. 15:4.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> For whatsoever things were written aforetime were written for
<br>our learning, that we through patience and comfort of  the scriptures might have hope.
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Matt. 4:4,  7,  10.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> But he answered and said, It is written, Man shall not live by bread
<br>alone, but by every word that proceedeth out of  the mouth of  God.… Jesus said unto
<br>him, It is written again, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.… Then saith Jesus
<br>unto him, Get thee hence, Satan: for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">God, and him only shalt thou serve.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Isa. 8:20.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> To the law and to the testimony: if
<br>they speak not according to this word, it is because there is no light in them.
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:907px; width:270px; height:46px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">e.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">2 Tim. 3:15.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> … and that from a child thou hast known the holy scriptures,
<br>which are able to make thee wise unto salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus.
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">2 Pet. 1:19.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> We have also a more sure word of  prophecy; whereunto ye do well that
<br>ye take heed, as unto a light that shineth in a dark place, until the day dawn, and the
<br>day star arise in your hearts.
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:35px; top:953px; width:270px; height:156px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">f.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">John 20:31.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> But these are written, that ye might believe that Jesus is the Christ,
<br>the Son of  God; and that believing ye might have life through his name.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">1  Cor.
<br>14:37.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> If  any man think himself  to be a prophet, or spiritual, let him acknowledge
<br>that the things that I write unto you are the commandments of  the Lord.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">1 John
<br>5:13.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> These things have I written unto you that believe on the name of  the Son of
<br>God; that ye may know that ye have eternal life, and that ye may believe on the name
<br>of  the Son of  God.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">1 Cor. 10:11.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Now all these things happened unto them for
<br>ensamples:  and  they  are  written  for  our  admonition,  upon  whom  the  ends  of   the
<br>world are come.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Heb. 1:1–2. </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">God, who at sundry times and in divers manners spake
<br>in time past unto the fathers by the prophets, hath in these last days spoken unto us by
<br>his Son, whom he hath appointed heir of  all things, by whom also he made the worlds.
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Heb. 2:2–4.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> For if  the word spoken by angels was stedfast, and every transgression
<br>and disobedience received a just recompence of  reward; how shall we escape, if  we
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">neglect so great salvation; which at the first began to be spoken by the Lord, and was
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">confirmed unto us by them that heard him; God also bearing them witness, both with
<br>signs and wonders, and with divers miracles, and gifts of  the Holy Ghost, according to
<br>his own will?
<br></span></div><span style="position:absolute; border: gray 1px solid; left:0px; top:1194px; width:342px; height:522px;"></span>

<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:42px; top:1519px; width:58px; height:34px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">to the Romans

<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:222px; top:1450px; width:60px; height:22px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">second Epistles
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">of  Peter
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:216px; top:1473px; width:69px; height:11px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">The first, second,
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:222px; top:1484px; width:70px; height:23px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">and third Epistles
<br>of  John
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:215px; top:1530px; width:61px; height:11px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">The Revelation
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:1559px; width:270px; height:23px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">All which are given by inspiration of  God to be the rule of  faith and
<br>life.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">g
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:35px; top:1590px; width:270px; height:92px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">g.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Luke 16:29,  31.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Abraham saith unto him, They have Moses and the proph-
<br>ets; let them hear them.… And he said unto him, If  they hear not Moses and the
<br>prophets, neither will they be persuaded, though one rose from the dead.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Luke 24:27,
<br>44.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> And beginning at Moses and all the prophets, he expounded unto them in all the
<br>scriptures the things concerning himself.… And he said unto them, These are the
<br>words which I spake unto you, while I was yet with you, that all things must be fulfilled,
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">which were written in the law of  Moses, and in the prophets, and in the psalms, con-
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">cerning me.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">2 Tim. 3:15–16.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> … and that from a child thou hast known the holy
<br>scriptures, which are able to make thee wise unto salvation through faith which is in
<br>Christ Jesus. All scripture is given by inspiration of  God, and is profitable for doctrine,
<br></span></div><span style="position:absolute; border: gray 1px solid; left:0px; top:1766px; width:342px; height:522px;"></span>
<div style="position:absolute; top:1766px;"><a name="4">Page 4</a></div>
<div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:1792px; width:4px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">4
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:116px; top:1792px; width:109px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">THE CONFESSION OF FAITH
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:261px; top:1792px; width:44px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">CHAPTER 1
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:1809px; width:269px; height:46px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">3.  The books commonly called Apocrypha, not being of  divine
<br>inspiration, are no part of  the canon of  the Scripture, and therefore
<br>are of  no authority in the church of  God, nor to be any otherwise
<br>approved, or made use of, than other human writings.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">h
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:1855px; width:270px; height:46px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">4.  The authority of  the Holy Scripture, for which it ought to be
<br>believed, and obeyed, dependeth not upon the testimony of  any man,
<br>or church; but wholly upon God (who is truth itself) the author thereof:
<br>and therefore it is to be received, because it is the Word of  God.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">i
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:1901px; width:270px; height:80px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">5.  We may be moved and induced by the testimony of  the church

<div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:3508px; width:44px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">CHAPTER 1
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:116px; top:3508px; width:109px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">THE CONFESSION OF FAITH
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:302px; top:3508px; width:4px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">7
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:3525px; width:270px; height:184px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">8.    The  Old  Testament  in  Hebrew  (which  was  the  native  lan-
<br>guage of  the people of  God of  old), and the New Testament in Greek
<br>(which, at the time of  the writing of  it, was most generally known to
<br>the nations), being immediately inspired by God, and, by his singular
<br>care and providence, kept pure in all ages, are therefore authentical;</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">r
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">so as, in all controversies of  religion, the church is finally to appeal
<br>unto them.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">s</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px"> But, because these original tongues are not known to all
<br>the people of  God, who have right unto, and interest in the Scrip-
<br>tures, and are commanded, in the fear of  God, to read and search
<br>them,</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">t</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px"> therefore they are to be translated into the vulgar language of
<br>every nation unto which they come,</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">u</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px"> that, the Word of  God dwelling
<br>plentifully in all, they may worship him in an acceptable manner;</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">w
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">and, through patience and comfort of  the Scriptures, may have hope.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">x
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">9.  The infallible rule of  interpretation of  Scripture is the Scrip-

<br>that sinned, so is the gift: for the judgment was by one to condemnation, but the free

<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">ness shall reign in life by one, Jesus Christ.) therefore as by the offence of  one judgment

<br>came upon all men unto justification of  life. For as by one man’s disobedience many
<br>were made sinners, so by the obedience of  one shall many be made righteous.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">1 Cor.

<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Rom. 7:14,  17–18,  21–23.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> For we know that the law is spiritual: but I am carnal,
<br>sold under sin.… Now then it is no more I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me. For I
<br>know that in me (that is, in my flesh,) dwelleth no good thing: for to will is present with
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">me; but how to perform that which is good I find not.… I find then a law, that, when
<br>I would do good, evil is present with me. For I delight in the law of  God after the
<br>inward man: but I see another law in my members, warring against the law of  my
<br>mind,  and  bringing  me  into  captivity  to  the  law  of   sin  which  is  in  my  members.
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">1 John 1:8,  10.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> If  we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is
<br>not in us.… If  we say that we have not sinned, we make him a liar, and his word is not
<br>in us.
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:15825px; width:270px; height:73px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">m.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Rom. 7:7–8,  25.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> What shall we say then? Is the law sin? God forbid. Nay, I
<br>had not known sin, but by the law: for I had not known lust, except the law had said,
<br>Thou shalt not covet. But sin, taking occasion by the commandment, wrought in me
<br>all manner of  concupiscence. For without the law sin was dead.… I thank God through
<br>Jesus Christ our Lord. So then with the mind I myself  serve the law of  God; but with
<br>the flesh the law of  sin.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Gal. 5:17.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> For the flesh lusteth against the Spirit, and the
<br>Spirit against the flesh: and these are contrary the one to the other: so that ye cannot
<br>do the things that ye would.
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:49px; top:15899px; width:256px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">n.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">1 John 3:4.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Whosoever committeth sin transgresseth also the law: for sin is the

<br>conscience also bearing witness, and their thoughts the mean while accusing or else
<br>excusing one another.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Rom. 3:9,  19.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> What then? are we better than they? No, in no
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">wise: for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles, that they are all under sin.…
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">Now we know that what things soever the law saith, it saith to them who are under the
<br>law: that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world may become guilty before

<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:16681px; width:270px; height:34px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">2.  The first covenant made with man was a covenant of  works,</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">b

God forbid: for if

<br>all nations be blessed. So then they which be of  faith are blessed with faithful Abra-
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">ham.… that the blessing of  Abraham might come on the Gentiles through Jesus Christ;
<br>that we might receive the promise of  the Spirit through faith.… Now to Abraham and
<br>his seed were the promises made. He saith not, And to seeds, as of  many; but as of
<br>one, And to thy seed, which is Christ.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Rom. 3:21–22,  30.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> But now the righteousness
<br>of  God without the law is manifested, being witnessed by the law and the prophets;
<br>even the righteousness of  God which is by faith of  Jesus Christ unto all and upon all
<br>them that believe: for there is no difference.… seeing it is one God, which shall justify
<br>the circumcision by faith, and uncircumcision through faith.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Rom. 4:3,  6–8.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> For
<br>what saith the scripture? Abraham believed God, and it was counted unto him for
<br>righteousness.… Even as David also describeth the blessedness of  the man, unto whom
<br>God imputeth righteousness without works, saying, Blessed are they whose iniquities
<br>are forgiven, and whose sins are covered. Blessed is the man to whom the Lord will not
<br>impute sin.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">See Gen. 15:6.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Ps. 32:1–2.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Blessed is he whose transgression is for-

<br>iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no guile.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Rom. 4:16–17,  23–24.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Therefore it is
<br>of  faith, that it might be by grace; to the end the promise might be sure to all the seed;
<br>not to that only which is of  the law, but to that also which is of  the faith of  Abraham;
<br>who is the father of  us all, (as it is written, I have made thee a father of  many nations,)
<br>before him whom he believed, even God, who quickeneth the dead, and calleth those
<br>things which be not as though they were.… Now it was not written for his sake alone,
<br>that it was imputed to him; but for us also, to whom it shall be imputed, if  we believe
<br>on him that raised up Jesus our Lord from the dead.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Heb. 4:2.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> For unto us was the
<br>gospel preached, as well as unto them: but the word preached did not profit them, not

<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:25050px; width:270px; height:82px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">k.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Gal. 5:17.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> For the flesh lusteth against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the
<br>flesh: and these are contrary the one to the other: so that ye cannot do the things that
<br>ye would.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Rom. 7:14–25.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> For we know that the law is spiritual: but I am carnal, sold
<br>under sin. For that which I do I allow not: for what I would, that do I not; but what I
<br>hate, that do I. If  then I do that which I would not, I consent unto the law that it is
<br>good. Now then it is no more I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me. For I know that
<br>in me (that is, in my flesh,) dwelleth no good thing: for to will is present with me; but
<br>how to perform that which is good I find not. For the good that I would I do not: but
<br>the evil which I would not, that I do. Now if  I do that I would not, it is no more I that

<div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:25244px; width:48px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">CHAPTER 10
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:116px; top:25244px; width:109px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">THE CONFESSION OF FAITH

<br>present  with  me.  For  I  delight  in  the  law  of   God  after  the  inward  man:  but  I  see
<br>another law in my members, warring against the law of  my mind, and bringing me
<br>into captivity to the law of  sin which is in my members. O wretched man that I am!
<br>who shall deliver me from the body of  this death? I thank God through Jesus Christ
<br>our Lord. So then with the mind I myself  serve the law of  God; but with the flesh the
<br>law of  sin.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">1 John 1:8,  10.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> If  we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and

<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:297px; top:28676px; width:8px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">51
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:28693px; width:270px; height:80px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">and by accounting and accepting their persons as righteous; not for
<br>anything wrought in them, or done by them, but for Christ’s sake

<br>past, through the forbearance of  God; to declare, I say, at this time his righteousness:
<br>that he might be just, and the justifier of  him which believeth in Jesus. Where is boast-
<br>ing then? It is excluded. By what law? of  works? Nay: but by the law of  faith. There-
<br>fore we conclude that a man is justified by faith without the deeds of  the law.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Titus

<br>redemption: that, according as it is written, He that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Rom. 5:17–19.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> … (For if  by one man’s offence death reigned by one; much more

<br>life by one, Jesus Christ.) therefore as by the offence of  one judgment came upon all
<br>men to condemnation; even so by the righteousness of  one the free gift came upon all

<div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:29248px; width:8px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">52

<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:257px; top:29248px; width:48px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">CHAPTER 11
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:29265px; width:270px; height:46px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">2.  Faith, thus receiving and resting on Christ and his righteous-
<br>ness, is the alone instrument of  justification:</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">d</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px"> yet is it not alone in the

<br>him. For if, when we were enemies, we were reconciled to God by the death of  his Son,
<br>much more, being reconciled, we shall be saved by his life.… Therefore as by the
<br>offence of  one judgment came upon all men to condemnation; even so by the righ-
<br>teousness of  one the free gift came upon all men unto justification of  life. For as by one
<br>man’s disobedience many were made sinners, so by the obedience of  one shall many

God did, from all eternity, decree to justify all the elect,</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">l</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px"> and

<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:30455px; width:270px; height:23px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">5.  God doth continue to forgive the sins of  those that are justified;</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">o
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">and, although they can never fall from the state of  justification,</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">p</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px"> yet

<br>sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteous-
<br>ness.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">1 John 2:1–2.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> My little children, these things write I unto you, that ye sin not.
<br>And if  any man sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous:
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">and he is the propitiation for our sins: and not for ours only, but also for the sins of  the
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">whole world.
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:30835px; width:269px; height:18px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">p.    </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Rom.  5:1–5.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Therefore  being  justified  by  faith,  we  have  peace  with  God
<br>through our Lord Jesus Christ: by whom also we have access by faith into this grace
<br></span></div><span style="position:absolute; border: gray 1px solid; left:0px; top:30938px; width:342px; height:522px;"></span>
<div style="position:absolute; top:30938px;"><a name="55">Page 55</a></div>
<div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:35px; top:30964px; width:48px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">CHAPTER 11
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:116px; top:30964px; width:109px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">THE CONFESSION OF FAITH
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:297px; top:30964px; width:8px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">55
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:30981px; width:270px; height:46px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">they may, by their sins, fall under God’s fatherly displeasure, and not
<br>have  the  light  of   his  countenance  restored  unto  them,  until  they
<br>humble themselves, confess their sins, beg pardon, and renew their
<br>faith and repentance.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">q
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:31027px; width:269px; height:23px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">6.  The justification of  believers under the old testament was, in
<br>all these respects, one and the same with the justification of  believers
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:31076px; width:270px; height:184px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">wherein we stand, and rejoice in hope of  the glory of  God. And not only so, but we
<br>glory in tribulations also: knowing that tribulation worketh patience; and patience,
<br>experience; and experience, hope: and hope maketh not ashamed; because the love of
<br>God is shed abroad in our hearts by the Holy Ghost which is given unto us.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Rom.
<br>8:30–39.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Moreover whom he did predestinate, them he also called: and whom he
<br>called, them he also justified: and whom he justified, them he also glorified. What shall
<br>we then say to these things? If  God be for us, who can be against us? He that spared
<br>not his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how shall he not with him also freely
<br>give us all things? Who shall lay any thing to the charge of  God’s elect? It is God that
<br>justifieth. Who is he that condemneth? It is Christ that died, yea rather, that is risen
<br>again, who is even at the right hand of  God, who also maketh intercession for us. Who
<br>shall separate us from the love of  Christ? shall tribulation, or distress, or persecution,
<br>or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword? As it is written, For thy sake we are killed
<br>all the day long; we are accounted as sheep for the slaughter. Nay, in all these things we
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">are more than conquerors through him that loved us. For I am persuaded, that neither
<br>death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor powers, nor things present, nor things
<br>to come, nor height, nor depth, nor any other creature, shall be able to separate us
<br>from the love of  God, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Heb. 10:14.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> For by one
<br>offering he hath perfected for ever them that are sanctified.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Cf. Luke 22:32; John
<br>10:28.
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:35px; top:31260px; width:270px; height:165px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">q.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Ps. 89:30–33.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> If  his children forsake my law, and walk not in my judgments;

<br>transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes. Nevertheless my lovingkind-
<br>ness will I not utterly take from him, nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Ps. 51.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Have
<br>mercy upon me, O God, according to thy lovingkindness: according unto the multi-
<br>tude of  thy tender mercies blot out my transgressions. Wash me throughly from mine
<br>iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin. For I acknowledge my transgressions: and my sin
<br>is ever before me.… Create in me a clean heart, O God; and renew a right spirit
<br>within me.… Restore unto me the joy of  thy salvation; and uphold me with thy free
<br>spirit.…  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Ps. 32:5.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> I acknowledged my sin unto thee, and mine iniquity have I not
<br>hid. I said, I will confess my transgressions unto the L</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:6px">ORD</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">; and thou forgavest the
<br>iniquity of  my sin. Selah.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Matt. 26:75.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> And Peter remembered the word of  Jesus,
<br>which said unto him, Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice. And he went
<br>out, and wept bitterly.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Luke 1:20.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> And, behold, thou shalt be dumb, and not able to
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">speak, until the day that these things shall be performed, because thou believest not
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">my words, which shall be fulfilled in their season.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">1 Cor. 11:30,  32.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> For this cause
<br>many are weak and sickly among you, and many sleep.… But when we are judged, we
<br>are chastened of  the Lord, that we should not be condemned with the world.

<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:31553px; width:104px; height:11px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">under the new testament.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">r

<br>Of  Adoption
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:31622px; width:270px; height:46px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">1.  All those that are justified, God vouchsafeth, in and for his
<br>only Son Jesus Christ, to make partakers of  the grace of  adoption,</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">a

<br>Abraham.… Christ hath redeemed us from the curse of  the law, being made a curse
<br>for us: for it is written, Cursed is every one that hangeth on a tree: that the blessing of
<br>Abraham might come on the Gentiles through Jesus Christ; that we might receive the
<br>promise of  the Spirit through faith.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Rom. 4:6–8,  22–24.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Even as David also describeth
<br>the blessedness of  the man, unto whom God imputeth righteousness without works,
<br>saying, Blessed are they whose iniquities are forgiven, and whose sins are covered.
<br>Blessed is the man to whom the Lord will not impute sin.… And therefore it was
<br>imputed to him for righteousness. Now it was not written for his sake alone, that it was
<br>imputed to him; but for us also, to whom it shall be imputed, if  we believe on him that
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">raised up Jesus our Lord from the dead.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Rom. 10:6–13.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> But the righteousness which
<br>is of  faith speaketh on this wise, Say not in thine heart, Who shall ascend into heaven?
<br>(that is, to bring Christ down from above:) or, Who shall descend into the deep? (that
<br>is, to bring up Christ again from the dead.) But what saith it? The word is nigh thee,
<br>even in thy mouth, and in thy heart: that is, the word of  faith, which we preach; that if
<br>thou shalt confess with thy mouth the Lord Jesus, and shalt believe in thine heart that
<br>God  hath  raised  him  from  the  dead,  thou  shalt  be  saved.  For  with  the  heart  man
<br>believeth unto righteousness; and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation.
<br>For the scripture saith, Whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed. For there is
<br>no difference between the Jew and the Greek: for the same Lord over all is rich unto all
<br>that call upon him. For whosoever shall call upon the name of  the Lord shall be saved.
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Heb. 13:8.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Jesus Christ the same yesterday, and to day, and for ever.

<br>monishing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing with grace in

<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:297px; top:44692px; width:8px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">79
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:139px; top:44710px; width:63px; height:13px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:13px">Chapter 18
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:54px; top:44725px; width:232px; height:13px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:13px">Of the Assurance of Grace and Salvation
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:35px; top:44751px; width:270px; height:91px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">1.  Although hypocrites and other unregenerate men may vainly
<br>deceive themselves with false hopes and carnal presumptions of  be-
<br>ing in the favor of  God, and estate of  salvation</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">a</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px"> (which hope of  theirs
<br>shall perish</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">b</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">): yet such as truly believe in the Lord Jesus, and love him
<br>in sincerity, endeavoring to walk in all good conscience before him,
<br>may,  in  this  life,  be  certainly  assured  that  they  are  in  the  state  of
<br>grace,</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">c</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px"> and may rejoice in the hope of  the glory of  God, which hope
<br>shall never make them ashamed.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">d
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:44843px; width:270px; height:23px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">2.  This certainty is not a bare conjectural and probable persua-
<br>sion grounded upon a fallible hope;</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">e</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px"> but an infallible assurance of
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:35px; top:44877px; width:270px; height:64px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">a.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Mic. 3:11.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> The heads thereof  judge for reward, and the priests thereof  teach
<br>for hire, and the prophets thereof  divine for money: yet will they lean upon the L</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:6px">ORD</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">,
<br>and say, Is not the L</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:6px">ORD</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> among us? none evil can come upon us.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Deut. 29:19.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> …
<br>and it come to pass, when he heareth the words of  this curse, that he bless himself  in
<br>his heart, saying, I shall have peace, though I walk in the imagination of  mine heart, to
<br>add drunkenness to thirst.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">John 8:41.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Ye do the deeds of  your father. Then said they
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">to him, We be not born of  fornication; we have one Father, even God.
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:35px; top:44942px; width:270px; height:46px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">b.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Amos 9:10.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> All the sinners of  my people shall die by the sword, which say,
<br>The evil shall not overtake nor prevent us.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Matt. 7:22–23.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Many will say to me in
<br>that day, Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in thy name? and in thy name have cast
<br>out devils? and in thy name done many wonderful works? And then will I profess unto
<br>them, I never knew you: depart from me, ye that work iniquity.
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:35px; top:44988px; width:270px; height:101px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">c.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">1 John 5:13.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> These things have I written unto you that believe on the name of
<br>the Son of  God; that ye may know that ye have eternal life, and that ye may believe on
<br>the name of  the Son of  God.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">1 John 2:3.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> And hereby we do know that we know him,
<br>if  we keep his commandments.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">1 John 3:14,  18–19,  21,  24.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> We know that we have
<br>passed  from  death  unto  life,  because  we  love  the  brethren.  He  that  loveth  not  his
<br>brother abideth in death.… My little children, let us not love in word, neither in tongue;
<br>but in deed and in truth.… And hereby we know that we are of  the truth, and shall
<br>assure our hearts before him.… Beloved, if  our heart condemn us not, then have we
<br>confidence toward God.… And he that keepeth his commandments dwelleth in him,

<br>given us.

<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">unto us.
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:35px; top:45126px; width:270px; height:27px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">e.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Heb. 6:11,  19.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> And we desire that every one of  you do shew the same dili-
<br>gence to the full assurance of  hope unto the end.… which hope we have as an anchor

<div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:45264px; width:8px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">80
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:116px; top:45264px; width:109px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">THE CONFESSION OF FAITH
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:257px; top:45264px; width:48px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">CHAPTER 18
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:45281px; width:270px; height:57px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">faith founded upon the divine truth of  the promises of  salvation,</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">f</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px"> the
<br>inward evidence of  those graces unto which these promises are made,</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">g
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">the testimony of  the Spirit of  adoption witnessing with our spirits
<br>that we are the children of  God,</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">h</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px"> which Spirit is the earnest of  our
<br>inheritance, whereby we are sealed to the day of  redemption.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">i
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:35px; top:45339px; width:270px; height:46px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">3.  This infallible assurance doth not so belong to the essence of
<br>faith, but that a true believer may wait long, and conflict with many
<br>difficulties, before he be partaker of  it:</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">k</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px"> yet, being enabled by the
<br>Spirit to know the things which are freely given him of  God, he may,
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:45394px; width:270px; height:36px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">f.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Heb. 6:17–18.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Wherein God, willing more abundantly to shew unto the heirs
<br>of  promise the immutability of  his counsel, confirmed it by an oath: that by two im-
<br>mutable things, in which it was impossible for God to lie, we might have a strong
<br>consolation, who have fled for refuge to lay hold upon the hope set before us.
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:45431px; width:270px; height:165px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">g.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">2 Pet. 1:4–11.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> … whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious
<br>promises: that by these ye might be partakers of  the divine nature, having escaped the
<br>corruption that is in the world through lust. And beside this, giving all diligence, add to
<br>your faith virtue; and to virtue knowledge; and to knowledge temperance; and to tem-
<br>perance patience; and to patience godliness; and to godliness brotherly kindness; and
<br>to brotherly kindness charity. For if  these things be in you, and abound, they make you
<br>that ye shall neither be barren nor unfruitful in the knowledge of  our Lord Jesus Christ.
<br>But he that lacketh these things is blind, and cannot see afar off, and hath forgotten
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">that he was purged from his old sins. Wherefore the rather, brethren, give diligence to
<br>make your calling and election sure: for if  ye do these things, ye shall never fall: for so

<br>28.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Then verily the first covenant had also ordinances of  divine service, and a worldly
<br>sanctuary. For there was a tabernacle made; the first, wherein was the candlestick, and
<br>the table, and the shewbread; which is called the sanctuary. And after the second veil,
<br>the tabernacle which is called the Holiest of  all.… Now when these things were thus
<br>ordained, the priests went always into the first tabernacle, accomplishing the service
<br>of  God. But into the second went the high priest alone once every year, not without
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">blood, which he offered for himself, and for the errors of  the people: the Holy Ghost
<br>this signifying, that the way into the holiest of  all was not yet made manifest, while as
<br>the first tabernacle was yet standing: which was a figure for the time then present, in
<br>which were offered both gifts and sacrifices, that could not make him that did the
<br>service perfect, as pertaining to the conscience; which stood only in meats and drinks,
<br>and divers washings, and carnal ordinances, imposed on them until the time of  refor-
<br>mation. But Christ being come an high priest of  good things to come, by a greater and
<br>more perfect tabernacle, not made with hands, that is to say, not of  this building;
<br>neither by the blood of  goats and calves, but by his own blood he entered in once into
<br>the holy place, having obtained eternal redemption for us.… It was therefore neces-
<br>sary that the patterns of  things in the heavens should be purified with these; but the
<br>heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these. For Christ is not entered
<br>into the holy places made with hands, which are the figures of  the true; but into heaven
<br>itself, now to appear in the presence of  God for us.…

<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">5.  The moral law doth forever bind all, as well justified persons as
<br>others, to the obedience thereof;</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">h</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px"> and that, not only in regard of  the

<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:35px; top:49352px; width:270px; height:193px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">g.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Ex. 21:1–23:19.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Now these are the judgments which thou shalt set before
<br>them. If  thou buy an Hebrew servant, six years he shall serve: and in the seventh he
<br>shall go out free for nothing.… He that smiteth a man, so that he die, shall be surely
<br>put to death.… And he that curseth his father, or his mother, shall surely be put to
<br>death.… If  an ox gore a man or a woman, that they die: then the ox shall be surely
<br>stoned, and his flesh shall not be eaten; but the owner of  the ox shall be quit.… If  a
<br>man shall steal an ox, or a sheep, and kill it, or sell it; he shall restore five oxen for an
<br>ox, and four sheep for a sheep.… And if  a man entice a maid that is not betrothed,
<br>and lie with her, he shall surely endow her to be his wife.… Thou shalt not suffer a
<br>witch to live.… Ye shall not afflict any widow, or fatherless child.… And ye shall be
<br>holy men unto me: neither shall ye eat any flesh that is torn of  beasts in the field; ye
<br>shall cast it to the dogs. Thou shalt not raise a false report: put not thine hand with the
<br>wicked to be an unrighteous witness.… Three times thou shalt keep a feast unto me in
<br>the year.… The first of  the firstfruits of  thy land thou shalt bring into the house of  the
<br>L</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:6px">ORD</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> thy God. Thou shalt not seethe a kid in his mother’s milk.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Cf. Gen. 49:10
<br>with 1 Pet. 2:13–14.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">1 Cor. 9:8–10.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Say I these things as a man? or saith not the
<br>law the same also? For it is written in the law of  Moses, Thou shalt not muzzle the
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">mouth of  the ox that treadeth out the corn. Doth God take care for oxen? Or saith he
<br>it altogether for our sakes? For our sakes, no doubt, this is written: that he that ploweth
<br>should plow in hope; and that he that thresheth in hope should be partaker of  his
<br>hope.
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:35px; top:49545px; width:270px; height:183px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">h.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Rom. 13:8–10.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Owe no man any thing, but to love one another: for he that

<br>covet; and if  there be any other commandment, it is briefly comprehended in this
<br>saying, namely, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself. Love worketh no ill to his
<br>neighbour: therefore love is the fulfilling of  the law.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Rom. 3:31.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Do we then make

<br>God through Jesus Christ our Lord. So then with the mind I myself  serve the law of
<br>God; but with the flesh the law of  sin.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">1 Cor. 9:21.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> [I became] to them that are

<br>thy father and mother; (which is the first commandment with promise;) that it may be
<br>well with thee, and thou mayest live long on the earth.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">1 John 2:3–4,  7.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> And hereby
<br>we do know that we know him, if  we keep his commandments. He that saith, I know
<br>him, and keepeth not his commandments, is a liar, and the truth is not in him.…
<br>Brethren, I write no new commandment unto you, but an old commandment which
<br>ye had from the beginning. The old commandment is the word which ye have heard
<br>from the beginning.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Cf. Rom. 3:20; Rom. 7:7–8 and 1 John 3:4 with Rom.

<br>This I say then, Walk in the Spirit, and ye shall not fulfil the lust of  the flesh. For the
<br>flesh lusteth against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh: and these are contrary
<br>the one to the other: so that ye cannot do the things that ye would. But if  ye be led of
<br>the Spirit, ye are not under the law. Now the works of  the flesh are manifest, which are

<br>variance, emulations, wrath, strife, seditions, heresies, envyings, murders, drunken-

<br>the fruit of  the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, gentleness, goodness, faith, meek-
<br>ness, temperance: against such there is no law.

Is the law sin? God forbid. Nay, I had
<br>not known sin, but by the law: for I had not known lust, except the law had said, Thou
<br>shalt not covet.… Was then that which is good made death unto me? God forbid. But
<br>sin, that it might appear sin, working death in me by that which is good; that sin by the
<br>commandment might become exceeding sinful.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Rom. 3:20.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Therefore by the deeds
<br>of  the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight: for by the law is the knowledge of
<br>sin.
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:50818px; width:270px; height:55px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">o.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">James 1:23–25.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> For if  any be a hearer of  the word, and not a doer, he is like

<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">into the perfect law of  liberty, and continueth therein, he being not a forgetful hearer,

<br>I was alive without the law once: but when the commandment came, sin revived, and

<div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:50984px; width:8px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">90

<br>witness that he was righteous, God testifying of  his gifts: and by it he being dead yet
<br>speaketh.… By faith Noah, being warned of  God of  things not seen as yet, moved
<br>with fear, prepared an ark to the saving of  his house; by the which he condemned the
<br>world, and became heir of  the righteousness which is by faith. By faith Abraham,
<br>when he was called to go out into a place which he should after receive for an inherit-
<br>ance, obeyed; and he went out, not knowing whither he went.… By faith Moses, when
<br>he was come to years, refused to be called the son of  Pharaoh’s daughter; choosing

<br>the earth is full of  thy riches.… The glory of  the L</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:6px">ORD</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> shall endure for ever: the L</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:6px">ORD
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">shall rejoice in his works. He looketh on the earth, and it trembleth: he toucheth the
<br>hills, and they smoke. I will sing unto the L</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:6px">ORD</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> as long as I live: I will sing praise to my

<br>and worship before thee, O Lord; and shall glorify thy name. For thou art great, and

<br>presence with thanksgiving, and make a joyful noise unto him with psalms. For the
<br>L</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:6px">ORD</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> is a great God, and a great King above all gods. In his hand are the deep places

<br>the L</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:6px">ORD</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> our maker.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Ps. 89:5–7.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O L</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:6px">ORD</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">:

<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:116px; top:56704px; width:109px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">THE CONFESSION OF FAITH
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:257px; top:56704px; width:48px; height:9px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">CHAPTER 21
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:56721px; width:270px; height:46px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:11px">instituted by himself, and so limited by his own revealed will, that he

<br>men, or the suggestions of  Satan, under any visible representation,
<br>or any other way not prescribed in the Holy Scripture.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:8px">b
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:36px; top:56779px; width:270px; height:18px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">our God is one L</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:6px">ORD</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">: and thou shalt love the L</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:6px">ORD</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> thy God with all thine heart, and
<br>with all thy soul, and with all thy might.
<br></span></div><div style="position:absolute; border: textbox 1px solid; writing-mode:lr-tb; left:35px; top:56797px; width:270px; height:368px;"><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">b.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Deut. 12:32.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> What thing soever I command you, observe to do it: thou shalt

<br>that made the world and all things therein, seeing that he is Lord of  heaven and earth,
<br>dwelleth not in temples made with hands; neither is worshipped with men’s hands, as

<br>figure, the likeness of  male or female, the likeness of  any beast that is on the earth, the
<br>likeness of  any winged fowl that flieth in the air, the likeness of  any thing that creepeth
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">on the ground, the likeness of  any fish that is in the waters beneath the earth: and lest
<br>thou lift up thine eyes unto heaven, and when thou seest the sun, and the moon, and
<br>the stars, even all the host of  heaven, shouldest be driven to worship them, and serve
<br>them, which the L</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:6px">ORD</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> thy God hath divided unto all nations under the whole heaven.
<br>But the L</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:6px">ORD</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> hath taken you, and brought you forth out of  the iron furnace, even out
<br>of  Egypt, to be unto him a people of  inheritance, as ye are this day.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Ex. 20:4–6.
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">Thou shalt not make unto thee any graven image, or any likeness of  any thing that is
<br>in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth:
<br>thou shalt not bow down thyself  to them, nor serve them: for I the L</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:6px">ORD</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> thy God am
<br>a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of  the fathers upon the children unto the third and
<br>fourth generation of  them that hate me; and shewing mercy unto thousands of  them
<br>that love me, and keep my commandments.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">John 4:23–24.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> But the hour cometh,
<br>and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth:
<br>for the Father seeketh such to worship him. God is a Spirit: and they that worship him
<br>must worship him in spirit and in truth.  </span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT-Bold; font-size:9px">Col. 2:18–23.</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px"> Let no man beguile you of
<br>your reward in a voluntary humility and worshipping of  angels, intruding into those
<br>things which he hath not seen, vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind, and not holding
<br>the Head, from which all the body by joints and bands having nourishment minis-
<br>tered, and knit together, increaseth with the increase of  God. Wherefore if  ye be dead
<br>with Christ from the rudiments of  the world, why, as though living in the world, are ye
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">subject to ordinances, (touch not; taste not; handle not; which all are to perish with the
<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">using;) after the commandments and doctrines of  men? Which things have indeed a
<br>shew of  wisdom in will worship, and humility, and neglecting of  the body; not in any
<br>honour to the satisfying of  the flesh.

<br></span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">pleasure, nor speaking thine own words: then shalt thou delight thyself  in the L</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:6px">ORD</span><span style="font-family: BaskervilleMT; font-size:9px">;
